publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2144# Linda Fabiani: Scotland's Nobel Prize Winners—That the Parliament notes those Scots who have become Nobel Laureates since the prize was inaugurated in 1901 and, in particular, notes the contribution of Scotland’s first Nobel Laureate, Sir William Ramsay, who received the honour in 1904 "in recognition of his services in the discovery of the inert gaseous elements in air, and his determination of their place in the periodic system" and recognises that the example set by Scotland’s Nobel Laureates is an effective generator of confidence and wellbeing.

S2M-2144# Linda Fabiani: Scotland’s Nobel Prize Winners—That the Parliament notes those Scots who have become Nobel Laureates since the prize was inaugurated in 1901 and, in particular, notes the contribution of Scotland’s first Nobel Laureate, Sir William Ramsay, who received the honour in 1904 "in recognition of his services in the discovery of the inert gaseous elements in air, and his determination of their place in the periodic system" and recognises that the example set by Scotland’s Nobel Laureates is an effective generator of confidence and wellbeing.
S2M-2144# Scotland’s Nobel Prize Winners (lodged on 9 December 2004) Michael Matheson*, Donald Gorrie*, Christine Grahame*, Fiona Hyslop*, Mr Adam Ingram*

S2M-2144# Scotland’s Nobel Prize Winners (lodged on 9 December 2004) Rob Gibson*, Robert Brown*, Bruce Crawford*, Murdo Fraser*, Brian Adam*, Michael McMahon*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Jim Mather*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Eleanor Scott*, Jackie Baillie*, Roseanna Cunningham*

S2M-2144# Scotland's Nobel Prize Winners (lodged on 9 December 2004) Patrick Harvie*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr David Davidson*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Elaine Smith*, Cathie Craigie*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2144# Scotland’s Nobel Prize Winners (lodged on 9 December 2004) Mr Jamie Stone*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-2144# Scotland’s Nobel Prize Winners (lodged on 9 December 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
